intro: Rungia polygonoides, commonly known as the red-rooted shrub, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
